intro: Rudbeckia serotina f. tubuliformis, commonly known as the late rudbeckia or latecone rudbeckia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces elongated, tubular flower heads that bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soils. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
